author: huyenltnguyen
message:
fix(curriculum): improve description of Greeting Card step 15 and 16 (#57672)

Co-authored-by: Ilenia <26656284+ilenia-magoni@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Dario-DC <105294544+Dario-DC@users.noreply.github.com>

files.patch:
@@ -7,13 +7,13 @@ dashedName: step-15
 
 # --description--
 
-Add a new selector that targets the pseudoelement `::before` of the `h1` element,
+You can add an emoji in front of the title using the pseudo-element `::before` of the `h1` element.
 
-Use the `content` property to put the emoji ðŸ¥³ in front of the title: give it a value of `"ðŸ¥³ "` (note there is a space after the emoji).
+Create an `h1::before` selector, give it a `content` property and set its value to `"ðŸ¥³ "` (note there is a space after the emoji).
 
 # --hints--
 
-You should have a `h1::before` selector.
+You should have an `h1::before` selector.
 
 ```js
 assert.exists(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle("h1::before"));

@@ -7,11 +7,13 @@ dashedName: step-16
 
 # --description--
 
-Now you can do something similar to add the emoji also after the title: create a `h1::after` selector, give it a `content` property and set the value to `" ðŸ¥³"` (note there is a space before the emoji).
+Now you can do something similar to add the emoji also after the title. 
+
+Create a selector that targets the pseudo-element `::after` of the `h1` element. Give it a `content` property and set its value to `" ðŸ¥³"` (note there is a space before the emoji).
 
 # --hints--
 
-You should have a `h1::after` selector.
+You should have an `h1::after` selector.
 
 ```js
 assert.exists(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle("h1::after"));
